moves.1. e4: This was a blitz game played on Gameknot. White opened with 1.e4 and instead of my favorite response 1... c5 I played 1...e5 which I have been doing more in Blitz to try and enhance my play of double king pawn openings. We went into a Ruy Lopez and White blundered early and resigned after the 8th move.
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6: So far simple and on book.
moves.4... dxc6 5. h3: Slightly taken aback by this move. White wants to prevent the pin, but when he played 4.Bxc6 I thought a grander plan was about to be put into play.
moves.5... Nf6: I develop, threaten e4, and wait for either what he has in store or a opportunity for me.
moves.6... Bc5: Now if 7. Nxe5  Qd4 and white is in early trouble.
moves.7. Nxe5: Missed the threat, and here is the opportunity.
moves.7... Qd4 8. Ng4: After long consideration. White was destined to lose a knight.
moves.8... Bxg4:
White Resigns. 
An early blunder left White in a losing position he did not wish to play out.
